abstract.p: Roslyn Sholin letter on May 14 travel article recalls recent trip to New York City when she and two friends recreated opening scene of Breakfast at Tiffany's; photo (S)

block.p: To the Editor: I read with interest ''Bright Lights, Big City . . . Action!'' To the Editor: I read with interest ''Bright Lights, Big City . . . Action!'' (May 14) since I visited New York (my home town) on vacation last fall and with two friends, reproduced the opening scene of ''Breakfast at Tiffany's.'' Wearing our little black dresses, we arrived at Tiffany's with pearls, tiaras, long black gloves, coffee and croissants.
We didn't know we would stop both pedestrian and vehicular traffic. People gathered and peppered us with questions. We had no shortage of volunteers to take our picture.
And when we arrived at our next stop, Trump Tower, ''Moon River'' was playing, a serendipitous outtake that not even a seasoned director could have improved on.
